Permission Variables:

Variable Default Description UID 1000 User ID inside container GID 1000 Group ID inside container SKIP_CHOWN_DATA false Skip ownership changes (for pre-configured permissions)

docs.title: Autopause / Autostop
docs.text:
Autopause - Pauses the server process when no players are online:

Variable Default Description ENABLE_AUTOPAUSE false Enable autopause feature AUTOPAUSE_TIMEOUT_EST 3600 Seconds after last player leaves AUTOPAUSE_TIMEOUT_INIT 600 Seconds after start with no connections AUTOPAUSE_PERIOD 10 Status check interval MAX_TICK_TIME - Set to -1 to disable watchdog (recommended)

Autostop - Completely stops the container when idle:

Variable Default Description ENABLE_AUTOSTOP false Enable autostop feature AUTOSTOP_TIMEOUT_EST 3600 Seconds after last player leaves AUTOSTOP_TIMEOUT_INIT 1800 Seconds after start with no connections AUTOSTOP_PERIOD 10 Status check interval

Comparison:

Feature Autopause Autostop Behavior Pauses JVM process Stops container Recovery Instant resume Requires container restart Resource Savings Medium (CPU only) High (CPU + most memory) Best For Quick response needed Maximum savings

docs.title: Environment Variable Interpolation
docs.text:
The server supports dynamic configuration through variable substitution:

Syntax: ${CFG_VARIABLE_NAME}

Variable Default Description REPLACE_ENV_IN_PLACE true Enable variable replacement in config files REPLACE_ENV_VARIABLE_PREFIX CFG_ Prefix for replaceable variables REPLACE_ENV_DURING_SYNC false Replace in synced /plugins, /mods, /config REPLACE_ENV_VARIABLES_EXCLUDES - Files to exclude from replacement REPLACE_ENV_VARIABLES_EXCLUDE_PATHS - Paths to exclude

Supported File Types: .yml, .yaml, .txt, .cfg, .conf, .properties

Secret Files: Append _FILE to variable name to read from mounted file: 

environment:
  RCON_PASSWORD_FILE: /run/secrets/rcon_password

docs.title: mc-router
docs.text: mc-router is a connection multiplexer that enables multiple Minecraft servers to share a single IP address and port (25565) using hostname-based routing.

docs.title: Routing Methods
docs.text:
1. Command-Line Mapping: 

mc-router -mapping "server1.example.com=mc-server1:25565,server2.example.com=mc-server2:25565"

2. JSON Configuration File: 

{
  "default-server": "vanilla:25565",
  "mappings": {
    "survival.example.com": "mc-survival:25565",
    "creative.example.com": "mc-creative:25565"
  }
}

3. Docker Auto-Discovery (Recommended for Docker Compose):

Set -in-docker flag and use Docker labels:

services:
  mc-router:
    image: itzg/mc-router
    command: --in-docker --auto-scale-up --auto-scale-down
    ports:
      - "25565:25565"
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock

  mc-survival:
    image: itzg/minecraft-server
    labels:
      - "mc-router.host=survival.local"
      - "mc-router.port=25565"

Docker Labels:

Label Description mc-router.host External hostname(s), comma-separated mc-router.port Backend port (default: 25565) mc-router.auto-scale-up Per-container override for auto-scale-up mc-router.auto-scale-down Per-container override for auto-scale-down

4. Kubernetes Service Discovery:

metadata:
  annotations:
    "mc-router.itzg.me/externalServerName": "survival.example.com"
    "mc-router.itzg.me/defaultServer": "true"

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
Key Environment Variables / Flags:

Flag Environment Variable Default Description -port PORT 25565 Listen port -default DEFAULT - Default backend server -in-docker - - Enable Docker auto-discovery -in-kube-cluster - - Enable Kubernetes discovery -mapping MAPPING - Static hostname mappings -connection-rate-limit CONNECTION_RATE_LIMIT 1 Connections per second limit

docs.title: Auto-Scaling
docs.text:
mc-router can automatically start stopped containers when players connect and stop idle containers.

Configuration:

Flag Environment Variable Default Description -auto-scale-up AUTO_SCALE_UP false Start stopped containers on connect -auto-scale-down AUTO_SCALE_DOWN false Stop idle containers -auto-scale-down-after AUTO_SCALE_DOWN_AFTER 10m Idle timeout before stopping -docker-timeout DOCKER_TIMEOUT 60 Seconds to wait for container start

MOTD for Sleeping Servers:

Flag Environment Variable Default -auto-scale-asleep-motd AUTO_SCALE_ASLEEP_MOTD Server is sleeping. Connect to wake up!

Player Allow/Deny Lists:

Flag Description -auto-scale-up-allow-list File of player UUIDs/usernames allowed to wake servers -auto-scale-up-deny-list File of players blocked from waking servers

docs.title: Security Features
docs.text: Feature Description Port Scanner Blocking Connections without valid hostname are blocked Rate Limiting Configurable connections per second per IP DDoS Mitigation Connection throttling reduces attack surface

docs.title: Monitoring
docs.text: Flag Environment Variable Description -metrics-backend METRICS_BACKEND prometheus, influxdb, or discard -metrics-bind METRICS_BIND Metrics server bind address -record-logins RECORD_LOGINS Track player login metrics -webhook-url WEBHOOK_URL URL for player login/disconnect notifications

docs.title: Platform Support
docs.text:
Docker Images: itzg/mc-router

Architecture Supported amd64 (x86_64) Yes arm64 (Apple Silicon, AWS Graviton) Yes arm32v6 (Raspberry Pi) Yes

docs.title: Quick Reference Examples
docs.text:
Basic Paper Server with mc-router:

services:
  router:
    image: itzg/mc-router
    command: --in-docker --auto-scale-up --auto-scale-down
    ports:
      - "25565:25565"
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock

  mc-survival:
    image: itzg/minecraft-server:java21
    environment:
      EULA: "TRUE"
      TYPE: "PAPER"
      VERSION: "1.21.1"
      MEMORY: "4G"
      USE_AIKAR_FLAGS: "true"
    labels:
      - "mc-router.host=survival.local,survival.192.168.1.100.nip.io"
    volumes:
      - ./data:/data

Fabric Server with Mods:

services:
  mc-modded:
    image: itzg/minecraft-server:java21
    environment:
      EULA: "TRUE"
      TYPE: "FABRIC"
      VERSION: "1.20.4"
      MEMORY: "8G"
      MODRINTH_PROJECTS: |
        fabric-api
        sodium
        lithium
        iris
      MODRINTH_DOWNLOAD_DEPENDENCIES: required
    volumes:
      - ./data:/data

Forge Server with CurseForge Mods:

services:
  mc-forge:
    image: itzg/minecraft-server:java17
    environment:
      EULA: "TRUE"
      TYPE: "FORGE"
      VERSION: "1.20.1"
      MEMORY: "8G"
      CF_API_KEY: "${CF_API_KEY}"
      CURSEFORGE_FILES: |
        jei
        journeymap
        create
    volumes:
      - ./data:/data

Legacy Forge (1.16.5):

services:
  mc-legacy:
    image: itzg/minecraft-server:java8  # Java 8 required!
    environment:
      EULA: "TRUE"
      TYPE: "FORGE"
      VERSION: "1.16.5"
      MEMORY: "6G"
    volumes:
      - ./data:/data

docs.title: Git Workflow Guide
docs.text: This project follows Git-Flow branching strategy with strict conventions for commits, versioning, and development practices.

docs.title: Git-Flow Branching Strategy
docs.text:
main (production)
  │
  └── develop (integration)
        │
        ├── feature/xxx (new features)
        ├── bugfix/xxx (bug fixes)
        └── release/x.x.x (release preparation)

docs.title: Branch Naming Convention
docs.text: Branch Type Pattern Example Feature feature/<issue-number>-<description> feature/12-add-backup-script Bugfix bugfix/<issue-number>-<description> bugfix/15-fix-lock-release Release release/<version> release/1.0.0 Hotfix hotfix/<issue-number>-<description> hotfix/20-critical-fix

docs.title: Standard Workflow
docs.text:
1. Create GitHub Issue for task
  2. Create feature branch from develop
  3. Implement and commit with issue reference (#issue-number)
  4. Create PR to develop
  5. Merge after review
  6. Delete feature branch

docs.title: Commit Message Format
docs.text:
<type>: <description> (#<issue-number>)

<body>

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

docs.title: Commit Types
docs.text: Type Description Example feat New feature feat: add world backup command (#12) fix Bug fix fix: resolve lock file race condition (#15) docs Documentation docs: update CLI reference (#20) refactor Code refactoring refactor: extract validation logic (#25) test Tests test: add world locking tests (#30) chore Maintenance chore: bump dependencies (#35)

docs.title: Semantic Versioning
docs.text:
This project follows Semantic Versioning 2.0.0.

Format: MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH (e.g., 1.2.3)

Version When to Increment Example MAJOR Incompatible API/breaking changes 1.0.0 → 2.0.0 MINOR New features (backward compatible) 1.0.0 → 1.1.0 PATCH Bug fixes (backward compatible) 1.0.0 → 1.0.1

docs.title: Key Rules
docs.text:
• 0.x.x: Initial development, API may change anytime
  • 1.0.0: First stable release, public API defined
  • When MAJOR increments → reset MINOR and PATCH to 0
  • When MINOR increments → reset PATCH to 0

docs.title: Pre-release & Build Metadata
docs.text:
1.0.0-alpha      # Pre-release (lower precedence than 1.0.0)
1.0.0-alpha.1    # Pre-release with identifier
1.0.0-beta       # Beta release
1.0.0-rc.1       # Release candidate
1.0.0+20250117   # Build metadata (ignored in precedence)

Version Precedence: 1.0.0-alpha < 1.0.0-alpha.1 < 1.0.0-beta < 1.0.0-rc.1 < 1.0.0

docs.title: TDD (Test-Driven Development)
docs.text:
Follow the Red → Green → Refactor cycle:

  1. Red: Write a failing test first
  2. Green: Write minimal code to make the test pass
  3. Refactor: Clean up while keeping tests green
# Example for Bash scripts
# 1. Write test case in tests/test_lock.sh
# 2. Run test - expect failure
# 3. Implement in scripts/lock.sh
# 4. Run test - expect success
# 5. Refactor and verify tests still pass

docs.title: Tidy First
docs.text:
Never mix structural and behavioral changes in the same commit.

Change Type Examples Commit Separately Structural Rename, extract function, move file Yes Behavioral New feature, bug fix, logic change Yes

docs.title: Good Example
docs.text:
# Two separate commits
git commit -m "refactor: extract validate_world function"
git commit -m "feat: add world existence check (#7)"

docs.title: Bad Example
docs.text:
# Mixed in one commit - AVOID THIS
git commit -m "feat: add validation with new helper function"

docs.title: Task Checkpoint (task.md)
docs.text:
During development, use task.md to track work-in-progress:

# Current Task

## Working On
- [ ] Implementing lock.sh (#5)

## Context
- Started: 2025-01-17 14:00
- Branch: feature/5-world-locking

## Notes
- lock file format decided: <server>:<timestamp>:<pid>
- Need to handle stale locks

## Next Steps
- [ ] Test concurrent lock attempts
- [ ] Add to mcctl.sh

Important: task.md is in .gitignore - for local tracking only, not committed.

docs.title: Using plan.md
docs.text:
The plan.md file serves as the implementation roadmap:

  1. Before starting work: Read plan.md to understand the overall architecture
  2. Check current phase: Find the next unmarked task in the current phase
  3. Update as you go: Mark completed items, add discovered tasks
  4. Sync with GitHub Issues: Each phase/task maps to GitHub Issues

docs.title: Workflow
docs.text:
1. Read plan.md → Identify next task
2. Create GitHub Issue (if not exists)
3. Create feature branch
4. Implement following TDD
5. Mark task complete in plan.md
6. Commit and PR

docs.title: Code Quality Standards
docs.text:
• Eliminate duplication: Extract common patterns into reusable functions
  • Clear naming: Variables and functions should be self-documenting
  • Single responsibility: Each function does one thing well
  • Small commits: Atomic changes that are easy to review and revert

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Welcome to Docker Minecraft Server Management Platform. This guide will help you set up and manage multiple Minecraft servers using Docker.

docs.title: What is mcctl?
docs.text:
mcctl is a command-line tool for managing Docker-based Minecraft servers. It provides:

  • Easy server creation - Create Paper, Forge, Fabric, or Vanilla servers with a single command
  • Multi-server routing - Run multiple servers on a single machine with hostname-based routing
  • Auto-scaling - Servers automatically start when players connect and stop when idle
  • World management - Share and manage worlds across servers with locking support
  • GitHub backup - Automatic backup of world data to a private GitHub repository

docs.title: Architecture Overview
docs.text:
flowchart TB
    subgraph clients["Minecraft Clients"]
        C1["myserver.192.168.1.100.nip.io:25565"]
        C2["creative.192.168.1.100.nip.io:25565"]
    end

    subgraph router["mc-router (:25565)"]
        R["Hostname-based routing + Auto-scaling"]
    end

    subgraph servers["Minecraft Servers"]
        S1["mc-myserver<br/>(Paper 1.21.1)"]
        S2["mc-creative<br/>(Vanilla 1.20.4)"]
    end

    clients --> router
    router --> S1
    router --> S2

docs.title: Hostname-based Routing with nip.io
docs.text:
Connect to any server using magic DNS - no client configuration required:

myserver.192.168.1.100.nip.io:25565

nip.io automatically resolves the hostname to your server's IP address.

docs.title: Interactive CLI
docs.text:
mcctl provides both interactive and CLI modes:

Interactive ModeCLI Mode 
mcctl create
# Prompts for server name, type, version, etc.

mcctl create myserver -t PAPER -v 1.21.1

docs.title: Zero-downtime Server Management
docs.text:
• Servers start automatically when players connect
  • Servers stop after configurable idle timeout
  • Only mc-router runs when all servers are idle

docs.title: Complete Server Lifecycle
docs.text:
# Create a server
mcctl create myserver -t PAPER -v 1.21.1

# Configure the server
mcctl config myserver DIFFICULTY hard
mcctl config myserver MAX_PLAYERS 50
mcctl config myserver USE_AIKAR_FLAGS true

# Manage players
mcctl op myserver add Steve
mcctl whitelist myserver add Steve

# Monitor and control
mcctl status myserver
mcctl logs myserver -f
mcctl console myserver

# Backup and restore
mcctl backup push -m "Before upgrade"
mcctl backup restore

docs.title: Installation Guide
docs.text: This guide walks you through installing mcctl and setting up the required dependencies.

docs.title: System Requirements
docs.text:
Component Minimum Version Recommended Notes Node.js >= 18.0.0 20 LTS Required for mcctl CLI Docker Engine >= 24.0.0 Latest Container runtime Docker Compose >= 2.20.0 Latest include feature required OS Linux, macOS Ubuntu 22.04+ Windows via WSL2

Docker Compose Version

Docker Compose v2.20.0 or higher is required. The include directive used by mcctl was introduced in this version. Check your version with docker compose version.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text: Before installing mcctl, ensure you have the following installed:

docs.title: Docker
docs.text:
Docker is required to run Minecraft servers. Install Docker Engine:

Ubuntu/DebianCentOS/RHELmacOS 
# Add Docker's official GPG key
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install ca-certificates curl
sudo install -m 0755 -d /etc/apt/keyrings
sudo curl -fsSL https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu/gpg -o /etc/apt/keyrings/docker.asc
sudo chmod a+r /etc/apt/keyrings/docker.asc

# Add the repository
echo \
  "deb [arch=$(dpkg --print-architecture) signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/docker.asc] https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu \
  $(. /etc/os-release && echo "$VERSION_CODENAME") stable" | \
  sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/docker.list > /dev/null

# Install Docker
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io docker-compose-plugin

# Add your user to docker group
sudo usermod -aG docker $USER
newgrp docker

sudo dnf install -y dnf-plugins-core
sudo dnf config-manager --add-repo https://download.docker.com/linux/centos/docker-ce.repo
sudo dnf install docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io docker-compose-plugin
sudo systemctl enable --now docker
sudo usermod -aG docker $USER

Download and install Docker Desktop for Mac.

Verify Docker installation:

docker --version
# Docker version 24.0.0 or higher

docker compose version
# Docker Compose version v2.20.0 or higher

docs.title: Node.js
docs.text:
Node.js 18 or higher is required:

Using nvm (Recommended)Ubuntu/DebianmacOS (Homebrew) 
# Install nvm
curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nvm-sh/nvm/v0.39.0/install.sh | bash
source ~/.bashrc

# Install Node.js 20 LTS
nvm install 20
nvm use 20

curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_20.x | sudo -E bash -
sudo apt-get install -y nodejs

brew install node@20

Verify Node.js installation:

node --version
# v20.0.0 or higher

npm --version
# v10.0.0 or higher

docs.title: Global Installation (Recommended)
docs.text:
Install mcctl globally via npm:

npm install -g @minecraft-docker/mcctl

Or using pnpm:

pnpm add -g @minecraft-docker/mcctl

Verify installation:

mcctl --version
# mcctl version 1.6.9

docs.title: Using npx (No Installation)
docs.text:
You can also run mcctl without installing:

npx @minecraft-docker/mcctl --help

docs.title: Platform Initialization
docs.text:
After installing mcctl, initialize the platform:

mcctl init

This creates the platform directory structure at ~/minecraft-servers/:

~/minecraft-servers/
├── docker-compose.yml     # Main orchestration
├── .env                   # Environment configuration
├── servers/               # Server configurations
│   ├── compose.yml        # Server include list
│   └── _template/         # Server template
├── worlds/                # Shared world storage
├── shared/                # Shared plugins/mods
│   ├── plugins/
│   └── mods/
├── scripts/               # Management scripts
└── backups/               # Backup storage

Custom Data Directory

Use --root to specify a custom location: 

mcctl --root /path/to/data init

docs.title: Optional: mDNS Setup
docs.text:
For local network discovery using .local hostnames, install avahi-daemon:

Ubuntu/DebianCentOS/RHELmacOS 
sudo apt install avahi-daemon
sudo systemctl enable --now avahi-daemon

sudo dnf install avahi
sudo systemctl enable --now avahi-daemon

macOS has built-in Bonjour support - no additional installation needed.

nip.io Recommended

nip.io magic DNS is recommended over mDNS as it works without any client configuration. See Networking Guide for details.

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
Edit the environment file to customize settings:

nano ~/minecraft-servers/.env

Key settings:

# Your server's IP address (required for nip.io)
HOST_IP=192.168.1.100

# For VPN mesh with multiple IPs (Tailscale/ZeroTier)
# HOST_IPS=192.168.1.100,100.64.0.5

# Default server settings
DEFAULT_MEMORY=4G
DEFAULT_VERSION=1.20.4

# Timezone
TZ=Asia/Seoul

# RCON password (change in production!)
RCON_PASSWORD=changeme

docs.title: Verifying Installation
docs.text:
Run the status command to verify everything is working:

mcctl status

Expected output:

Platform Status
===============

Router: mc-router (running)
Servers: 0

No servers configured. Create one with:
  mcctl create <name>

docs.title: Docker Permission Denied
docs.text:
If you get a permission error:

# Add your user to the docker group
sudo usermod -aG docker $USER

# Apply the group change
newgrp docker

docs.title: Port 25565 Already in Use
docs.text:
Check if another process is using port 25565:

sudo lsof -i :25565

Stop the conflicting service or change the port in docker-compose.yml.

docs.title: mcctl Command Not Found
docs.text:
Ensure npm global bin is in your PATH:

# For npm
export PATH="$PATH:$(npm config get prefix)/bin"

# Add to ~/.bashrc for persistence
echo 'export PATH="$PATH:$(npm config get prefix)/bin"' >> ~/.bashrc

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text: Create your first Minecraft server in 5 minutes.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Ensure you have completed the installation steps:

  • [x] Docker installed and running
  • [x] Node.js 18+ installed
  • [x] mcctl installed (npm install -g @minecraft-docker/mcctl)
  • [x] Platform initialized (mcctl init)

docs.title: Interactive Mode (Recommended for Beginners)
docs.text:
Run the create command without arguments for guided setup:

mcctl create

You will be prompted for:

  1. Server name - A unique name (e.g., survival, creative)
  2. Server type - Paper, Vanilla, Forge, Fabric, etc.
  3. Minecraft version - e.g., 1.21.1, 1.20.4
  4. Memory allocation - Default is 4GB

docs.title: CLI Mode (For Automation)
docs.text:
Create a server with a single command:

mcctl create myserver -t PAPER -v 1.21.1

Options:

Option Description Default -t, --type Server type (PAPER, VANILLA, FORGE, FABRIC) PAPER -v, --version Minecraft version Latest -s, --seed World seed Random --no-start Create without starting Start automatically

docs.title: Step 2: Wait for Server to Start
docs.text:
The server will download and start automatically. Watch the logs:

mcctl logs myserver -f

Wait until you see:

[Server thread/INFO]: Done (X.XXXs)! For help, type "help"

First Start Takes Longer

The first start downloads Minecraft server files and generates the world. Subsequent starts are much faster.

docs.title: Find Your Server Address
docs.text:
Check the output from the create command or run:

mcctl status

You will see connection information:

Servers:
  mc-myserver (running)
    Connect: myserver.192.168.1.100.nip.io:25565

docs.title: Connect from Minecraft
docs.text:
1. Open Minecraft Java Edition
  2. Click Multiplayer > Add Server
  3. Enter the server address: myserver.192.168.1.100.nip.io:25565
  4. Click Done and join!

Connection Methods

nip.io (Recommended)mDNSDirect IP

Works from any network with internet access: 

myserver.192.168.1.100.nip.io:25565

Works on local network (requires avahi/Bonjour): 

myserver.local:25565

If DNS doesn't work: 

192.168.1.100:25565

docs.title: View Server Status

Output:

Platform Status
===============

Servers:
  mc-myserver
    Status: running
    Type: PAPER 1.21.1
    Memory: 4G
    Players: 0/20

docs.title: View Server Logs

# Follow logs in real-time

docs.text: mcctl stop myserver

docs.title: Start the Server

Auto-Start on Connect

With mc-router, stopped servers automatically start when a player attempts to connect.

This opens an interactive RCON session:

> list
There are 0 of a max of 20 players online:

Press Ctrl+C to exit.

docs.title: Example: Create Multiple Servers
docs.text:
Create additional servers for different game modes:

# Creative server with specific seed
mcctl create creative -t VANILLA -v 1.21.1 -s 12345

# Modded server with Forge
mcctl create modded -t FORGE -v 1.20.4

# Check all servers

Each server gets its own hostname:

  • creative.192.168.1.100.nip.io:25565
  • modded.192.168.1.100.nip.io:25565

docs.title: Server Won't Start
docs.text:
1. Check logs for errors: 

    mcctl logs <server> -n 100

  2. Verify EULA is accepted: 

    mcctl config <server> EULA
# Should show: EULA=TRUE

  3. Check Java version compatibility:

  4. Minecraft 1.21+ requires Java 21
  5. Minecraft 1.18-1.20.4 requires Java 17+
  6. Forge 1.16.5 and below requires Java 8

docs.title: Can't Connect to Server
docs.text:
1. Verify mc-router is running: 

    mcctl status
# mc-router should show "running" and "healthy"

  2. Check server hostname: 

    mcctl status <server>
# Note the hostname (e.g., myserver.192.168.1.100.nip.io)

  3. Ensure server is running: 

    mcctl start <server>

docs.title: Server Crashes
docs.text:
1. Check memory allocation: 

    mcctl config <server> MEMORY
# Increase if needed: mcctl config <server> MEMORY 6G

  2. Check for mod conflicts: 

    mcctl logs <server> | grep -i "error\|exception"

docs.title: Permission Denied Errors
docs.text:
# Fix file ownership (if needed)
sudo chown -R $USER:$USER ~/minecraft-servers/

For more detailed troubleshooting, see the itzg/minecraft-server documentation.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: A guide for building Minecraft servers using Docker.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The itzg/minecraft-server image allows you to easily run a Minecraft Java Edition server in a Docker container.

docs.title: Docker CLI
docs.text:
docker run -d -it --name mc \
  -p 25565:25565 \
  -e EULA=TRUE \
  itzg/minecraft-server

docs.title: Docker Compose
docs.text:
services:
  mc:
    image: itzg/minecraft-server
    tty: true
    stdin_open: true
    ports:
      - "25565:25565"
    environment:
      EULA: "TRUE"
    volumes:
      - ./minecraft-data:/data

docs.title: Required Environment Variables
docs.text: Variable Description Required EULA Minecraft EULA agreement (must set TRUE) Required

docs.title: Basic Environment Variables
docs.text: Variable Default Description TYPE VANILLA Server type VERSION LATEST Minecraft version MEMORY 1G JVM heap memory TZ UTC Timezone

docs.title: Default Ports
docs.text: Port Purpose 25565 Minecraft server (TCP) 25575 RCON (TCP) 19132 Bedrock compatible (UDP, when using GeyserMC)

docs.title: Data Persistence
docs.text:
To persist server data, you must mount the /data volume:

docker run -d -it --name mc \
  -p 25565:25565 \
  -e EULA=TRUE \
  -v /path/to/minecraft-data:/data \
  itzg/minecraft-server

docs.title: View Server Logs
docs.text: docker logs -f mc

docs.title: Access Server Console
docs.text:
When RCON is enabled (default):

docker exec -i mc rcon-cli

docs.text: docker stop mc

docs.title: Data Directory
docs.text: Guide to the /data directory structure and volume management inside the container.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
All server data is stored under the /data path in the container. This path is declared as a Docker volume, so an anonymous volume is created if not explicitly configured.

Warning: Anonymous volumes may result in data loss when the container is deleted.

docs.title: Directory Structure
docs.text:
/data
├── server.jar          # Server executable
├── server.properties   # Server configuration
├── ops.json           # Operator list
├── whitelist.json     # Whitelist
├── banned-players.json
├── banned-ips.json
├── world/             # Default world
├── world_nether/      # Nether world
├── world_the_end/     # End world
├── plugins/           # Plugins (Paper/Spigot)
├── mods/              # Mods (Forge/Fabric)
├── config/            # Mod configurations
└── logs/              # Server logs

docs.title: Host Directory Bind
docs.text:
docker run -d \
  -v /home/user/minecraft-data:/data \

docs.title: SELinux / Podman Environments

docs.title: Converting Anonymous Volume to Named Volume
docs.text:
Method to migrate data from an existing anonymous volume to a named volume:

# 1. Stop existing container
docker stop mc

# 2. Find anonymous volume location
docker inspect -f "{{json .Mounts}}" mc | jq

# 3. Create new named volume and copy data
docker volume create mc-data
docker run --rm \
  -v OLD_VOLUME_PATH:/source:ro \
  -v mc-data:/dest \
  alpine cp -a /source/. /dest/

# 4. Run new container
docker run -d \
  -v mc-data:/data \
  -e EULA=TRUE \
  itzg/minecraft-server

docs.title: Server Properties
docs.text: How to manage server.properties file through environment variables.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
All server.properties entries can be set via environment variables. Variable names are converted to uppercase with - replaced by _.

Example: max-players → MAX_PLAYERS

docs.title: Basic Settings
docs.text: Variable Default Description MOTD - Server message (supports formatting codes, \n for multiline) DIFFICULTY easy peaceful, easy, normal, hard MODE survival survival, creative, adventure, spectator SEED - World seed (wrap negative numbers in quotes) LEVEL world World save folder name MAX_PLAYERS 20 Maximum player count PVP true Enable PvP

docs.text: Variable Description VIEW_DISTANCE Server view distance (chunks) SIMULATION_DISTANCE Simulation distance (chunks) MAX_TICK_TIME Max tick time (-1 to disable watchdog)

docs.title: World Generation
docs.text: Variable Description LEVEL_TYPE World type (default, flat, largeBiomes, amplified) GENERATOR_SETTINGS JSON format generator settings GENERATE_STRUCTURES Generate structures (true/false) SPAWN_ANIMALS Spawn animals SPAWN_MONSTERS Spawn monsters SPAWN_NPCS Spawn NPCs

docs.text: Variable Description WHITELIST Whitelisted players (comma/newline separated) WHITELIST_FILE Whitelist file path/URL OPS Operator players (comma/newline separated) OPS_FILE Operator file path/URL ENABLE_WHITELIST Enable whitelist ENFORCE_WHITELIST Enforce whitelist

docs.text: Variable Default Description ENABLE_RCON true Enable RCON RCON_PASSWORD - RCON password (required) RCON_PASSWORD_FILE - For Docker Secrets RCON_PORT 25575 RCON port

Set multiple properties at once with CUSTOM_SERVER_PROPERTIES:

environment:
  CUSTOM_SERVER_PROPERTIES: |
    allow-flight=true
    spawn-protection=0

services:
  mc:
    image: itzg/minecraft-server

      TYPE: "PAPER"
      VERSION: "1.20.4"

      ICON: "https://example.com/icon.png"

      # Game settings
      DIFFICULTY: "normal"
      MODE: "survival"
      PVP: "true"
      MAX_PLAYERS: "50"
      VIEW_DISTANCE: "12"

      # World
      LEVEL: "world"
      SEED: "12345"

      ENABLE_WHITELIST: "true"
      WHITELIST: "player1,player2"
      OPS: "admin1"

      RCON_PASSWORD: "secure_password"
    volumes:
      - ./data:/data

docs.title: JVM Options
docs.text: Java Virtual Machine memory and performance optimization settings.

docs.title: Basic Memory Variables
docs.text: Variable Default Description MEMORY 1G Set initial/max heap memory together INIT_MEMORY - Initial heap size (separate setting) MAX_MEMORY - Maximum heap size (separate setting)

docs.title: Format
docs.text:
• Absolute value: <size>[g|G|m|M|k|K]
  • Examples: 2G, 2048M, 2048m
  • Percentage: <size>%
  • Example: 75% (75% of container memory)

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
# Single value
environment:
  MEMORY: "4G"

# Separate initial/max
environment:
  INIT_MEMORY: "2G"
  MAX_MEMORY: "4G"

# Percentage of container memory
environment:
  MEMORY: "75%"

docs.title: Passing JVM Options
docs.text: Variable Purpose JVM_OPTS General JVM options (space separated) JVM_XX_OPTS -XX options only JVM_DD_OPTS System properties (name=value comma separated)

environment:

  JVM_XX_OPTS: "-XX:+UseG1GC -XX:MaxGCPauseMillis=200"
  JVM_DD_OPTS: "foo=bar,baz=qux"

docs.text:
Recommended GC tuning flags for Paper/Spigot servers:

environment:

Applied options include: - G1GC garbage collector - GC pause time optimization - Improved heap memory management

docs.title: Autopause / Autostop
docs.text: Features to save server resources when no players are online.

docs.title: Autopause
docs.text: Pauses the server process when no players are online.

docs.title: Enable
docs.text:
environment:
  ENABLE_AUTOPAUSE: "true"

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text: Variable Default Description ENABLE_AUTOPAUSE false Enable Autopause AUTOPAUSE_TIMEOUT_EST 3600 Wait time (seconds) after last player leaves before pausing AUTOPAUSE_TIMEOUT_INIT 600 Wait time (seconds) after server start without any connections before pausing AUTOPAUSE_TIMEOUT_KN 120 Wait time (seconds) after port connection attempt before pausing AUTOPAUSE_PERIOD 10 Status check interval (seconds) AUTOPAUSE_KNOCK_INTERFACE eth0 Network interface

docs.title: Additional Options
docs.text: Variable Description MAX_TICK_TIME Set to -1 to disable watchdog (recommended) DEBUG_AUTOPAUSE true - Enable debugging output

docs.title: Basic Example
docs.text:
services:
  mc:
    image: itzg/minecraft-server
    environment:
      EULA: "TRUE"
      ENABLE_AUTOPAUSE: "true"
      AUTOPAUSE_TIMEOUT_EST: "300"    # Pause after 5 minutes
      AUTOPAUSE_TIMEOUT_INIT: "120"   # 2 minutes after server start
      MAX_TICK_TIME: "-1"             # Disable watchdog
    ports:
      - "25565:25565"
    volumes:
      - ./data:/data

docs.title: Rootless Environment (Podman)
docs.text:
Additional configuration required for rootless containers:

services:
  mc:
    image: itzg/minecraft-server
    cap_add:
      - CAP_NET_RAW
    environment:
      EULA: "TRUE"
      ENABLE_AUTOPAUSE: "true"
      SKIP_SUDO: "true"

Docker CLI:

docker run -d \
  --cap-add=CAP_NET_RAW \
  -e EULA=TRUE \
  -e ENABLE_AUTOPAUSE=true \
  -e SKIP_SUDO=true \
  itzg/minecraft-server

docs.title: Manual Deployment (Manifests)
docs.text:
# deployment.yaml
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: minecraft
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: minecraft
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: minecraft
    spec:
      containers:
        - name: minecraft
          image: itzg/minecraft-server
          env:
            - name: EULA
              value: "TRUE"
            - name: TYPE
              value: "PAPER"
            - name: MEMORY
              value: "4G"
          ports:
            - containerPort: 25565
          volumeMounts:
            - name: data
              mountPath: /data
          resources:
            requests:
              memory: "4Gi"
              cpu: "1000m"
            limits:
              memory: "6Gi"
              cpu: "2000m"
      volumes:
        - name: data
          persistentVolumeClaim:
            claimName: minecraft-data
---
# pvc.yaml
apiVersion: v1
kind: PersistentVolumeClaim
metadata:
  name: minecraft-data
spec:
  accessModes:
    - ReadWriteOnce
  resources:
    requests:
      storage: 10Gi
---
# service.yaml
apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  name: minecraft
spec:
  type: LoadBalancer
  ports:
    - port: 25565
      targetPort: 25565
  selector:
    app: minecraft

#!/bin/bash
BACKUP_DIR="/backups/minecraft"
DATA_DIR="/opt/minecraft/data"
DATE=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)

docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
CONTAINER="mc"
BACKUP_DIR="./backups"
DATE=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)

mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"

# Save world
docker exec $CONTAINER rcon-cli save-all
sleep 5
docker exec $CONTAINER rcon-cli save-off

# Backup
tar -czf "$BACKUP_DIR/world_$DATE.tar.gz" ./data/world

# Re-enable saving
docker exec $CONTAINER rcon-cli save-on

# Delete old backups (7 days)
find "$BACKUP_DIR" -name "*.tar.gz" -mtime +7 -delete

docs.title: Complete Production Configuration
docs.text:
services:
  mc:
    image: itzg/minecraft-server:java21
    tty: true
    stdin_open: true
    restart: unless-stopped
    environment:
      EULA: "TRUE"
      TYPE: "PAPER"
      VERSION: "1.20.4"

      # Memory and Performance
      MEMORY: "8G"
      USE_AIKAR_FLAGS: "true"
      VIEW_DISTANCE: "10"
      SIMULATION_DISTANCE: "8"

      # Server Settings
      MOTD: "Welcome to Production Server"
      MAX_PLAYERS: "100"
      DIFFICULTY: "normal"
      PVP: "true"
      TZ: "Asia/Seoul"

      # Security
      ENABLE_WHITELIST: "true"
      WHITELIST_FILE: "/config/whitelist.txt"
      OPS_FILE: "/config/ops.txt"
      RCON_PASSWORD_FILE: "/run/secrets/rcon_password"

      # Logging
      LOG_TIMESTAMP: "true"
      ROLLING_LOG_MAX_FILES: "14"

      # Monitoring
      ENABLE_JMX: "true"
      JMX_HOST: "0.0.0.0"
    ports:
      - "25565:25565"
      - "7091:7091"
    volumes:
      - mc-data:/data
      - ./config:/config:ro
    secrets:
      - rcon_password
    healthcheck:
      test: mc-health
      start_period: 2m
      interval: 10s
      retries: 24
    deploy:
      resources:
        limits:
          memory: 10G
        reservations:
          memory: 8G

secrets:
  rcon_password:
    file: ./secrets/rcon_password.txt

volumes:
  mc-data:

docs.title: Mods and Plugins
docs.text: This guide covers installing mods and plugins for your Minecraft server using mcctl CLI.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Type Description Server Types Mods Modify game mechanics, require client installation Forge, Fabric, Quilt Plugins Server-side only, no client changes needed Paper, Spigot, Bukkit

docs.title: Create Server with Mod Support
docs.text:
First, create a server with the appropriate type for mods or plugins:

# For mods (Forge/Fabric)
mcctl create modded --type FABRIC --version 1.21.1

# For plugins (Paper)
mcctl create survival --type PAPER --version 1.21.1

docs.title: Configure Mods/Plugins
docs.text:
Use mcctl config to set mod and plugin sources:

# Modrinth mods (Fabric example)
mcctl config modded MODRINTH_PROJECTS "fabric-api,lithium,sodium"

# CurseForge mods (requires API key in .env)
mcctl config modded CURSEFORGE_FILES "jei,journeymap"

# SpigotMC plugins
mcctl config survival SPIGET_RESOURCES "28140,34315"

# Apply changes
mcctl stop modded && mcctl start modded

Restart Required

After changing mod/plugin configuration, restart the server to apply changes.

docs.title: Installation Sources
docs.text: Source Best For API Key Required mcctl Config Key Modrinth Modern mods/plugins No MODRINTH_PROJECTS CurseForge Large mod library Yes CURSEFORGE_FILES Spiget SpigotMC plugins No SPIGET_RESOURCES Direct Download Custom/private files No MODS / PLUGINS Modpacks Pre-configured collections Varies Server TYPE

docs.title: Modrinth vs CurseForge
docs.text: Feature Modrinth CurseForge API Key Not required Required Dependency Resolution Automatic Manual Version Auto-detect Yes No Mod Library Size Growing Largest Plugin Support Yes Limited

docs.title: Spiget vs Modrinth for Plugins
docs.text: Feature Spiget Modrinth Platform SpigotMC resources Modrinth projects ID Format Numeric resource ID Slug or project ID Dependency Support No Yes Download Restrictions Some plugins restricted None

docs.title: Setting Mod Sources
docs.text:
# View current configuration
mcctl config myserver

# Add Modrinth mods
mcctl config myserver MODRINTH_PROJECTS "fabric-api,lithium,sodium"

# Enable dependency download
mcctl config myserver MODRINTH_DOWNLOAD_DEPENDENCIES "required"

# Restart to apply
mcctl stop myserver && mcctl start myserver

docs.title: Setting Plugin Sources
docs.text:
# Modrinth plugins (Paper server)
mcctl config survival MODRINTH_PROJECTS "luckperms,chunky,spark"

# SpigotMC plugins (numeric IDs)
mcctl config survival SPIGET_RESOURCES "28140,34315,6245"

# Restart to apply
mcctl stop survival && mcctl start survival

docs.title: Using Shared Directories
docs.text:
mcctl init creates shared directories for mods and plugins:

~/minecraft-servers/
  shared/
    mods/       # Place mod JARs here (read-only mount)
    plugins/    # Place plugin JARs here (read-only mount)

Place your manually downloaded files in these directories. They are automatically mounted to all servers.

docs.title: Remove Old Mods
docs.text:
Configure automatic cleanup of old mods before applying new content:

mcctl config myserver REMOVE_OLD_MODS "TRUE"

docs.title: Exclude Specific Files
docs.text:
mcctl config myserver REMOVE_OLD_MODS_INCLUDE "*.jar"
mcctl config myserver REMOVE_OLD_MODS_EXCLUDE "keep-this-mod.jar"

docs.title: Hybrid Servers
docs.text:
For hybrid servers like Cardboard (Fabric with Bukkit plugins):

mcctl config myserver TYPE "FABRIC"
mcctl config myserver USES_PLUGINS "true"

docs.title: Environment Variable Processing
docs.text:
By default, environment variables in synced config files are processed. To disable:

mcctl config myserver REPLACE_ENV_DURING_SYNC "false"

docs.title: Advanced Configuration (Manual)
docs.text:
For complex configurations not supported by mcctl config, edit config.env directly:

# Edit server configuration file
nano ~/minecraft-servers/servers/myserver/config.env

Example config.env:

# Modrinth mods (multi-line format)
MODRINTH_PROJECTS=fabric-api
lithium
sodium
iris

# Dependency settings
MODRINTH_DOWNLOAD_DEPENDENCIES=required

docs.title: CurseForge
docs.text: Download mods and plugins from CurseForge - the largest mod hosting platform.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Feature Value Official Website https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft API Key Required Yes API Console https://console.curseforge.com/ Dependency Resolution Manual (metadata only) Mod Library Size Largest

docs.title: Step 1: Get API Key
docs.text:
1. Go to CurseForge API Console
  2. Sign in and create an API key
  3. Add the key to your platform .env file:
# Edit global environment file
nano ~/minecraft-servers/.env

# Add this line
CF_API_KEY=your_api_key_here

docs.title: Step 2: Create Server and Add Mods
docs.text:
# Create a Forge server
mcctl create modded --type FORGE --version 1.20.4

# Add CurseForge mods
mcctl config modded CURSEFORGE_FILES "jei,journeymap,jade"

# Restart to apply changes
mcctl stop modded && mcctl start modded

API Key Required

CurseForge requires an API key for all downloads. The key must be set in your .env file.

docs.title: Step 1: Create CurseForge Account
docs.text:
1. Go to CurseForge
  2. Click "Sign In" or "Register"
  3. Complete the registration process

docs.title: Step 2: Access API Console
docs.text:
1. Go to https://console.curseforge.com/
  2. Sign in with your CurseForge account
  3. Accept the API Terms of Service

docs.title: Step 3: Generate API Key
docs.text:
1. Click "Create API Key" or navigate to API Keys section
  2. Give your key a descriptive name (e.g., "Minecraft Docker Server")
  3. Copy the generated API key immediately

Security

  • Store your API key securely
  • Never commit API keys to version control
  • Add .env to your .gitignore file

docs.title: Step 4: Configure API Key
docs.text:
Add the API key to your platform's .env file:

# Edit .env file
nano ~/minecraft-servers/.env

# Add the API key
CF_API_KEY=your_api_key_here

Escaping $ in API Key

If your API key contains $, escape it with $$ in the .env file.

docs.title: Supported Reference Formats
docs.text:
Format Description Example Project URL Full URL to mod page https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/mc-mods/jei File URL URL with specific file https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/mc-mods/jei/files/4593548 Slug Short identifier from URL jei Project ID Numeric project identifier 238222 Slug:FileID Slug with specific file jei:4593548 ID:FileID Project ID with file ID 238222:4593548 Slug@Version Slug with version string jei@10.2.1.1005

Finding Project IDs

  1. Go to the mod page on CurseForge
  2. Scroll down to the "About Project" section
  3. Find "Project ID" (e.g., 238222 for JEI)

docs.title: Basic Setup
docs.text:
# Add mods (comma-separated)
mcctl config myserver CURSEFORGE_FILES "jei,journeymap,jade"

# Restart to apply
mcctl stop myserver && mcctl start myserver

docs.title: Specific Versions
docs.text:
# Pin to specific file ID
mcctl config myserver CURSEFORGE_FILES "jei:4593548,journeymap:4596105"

# Pin by version string
mcctl config myserver CURSEFORGE_FILES "jei@10.2.1.1005"

docs.title: Mixed References
docs.text:
# Different reference formats together
mcctl config myserver CURSEFORGE_FILES "jei,journeymap:4596105,238222"

docs.title: Configuration Reference
docs.text:
Config Key Description CURSEFORGE_FILES Comma/space/newline separated list of mod references

API Key Location

The CF_API_KEY is set in the platform .env file, not in individual server config.env files.

docs.title: Forge Mod Server
docs.text:
# Create server
mcctl create modded --type FORGE --version 1.20.4

# Configure mods
mcctl config modded CURSEFORGE_FILES "jei,journeymap,jade,mouse-tweaks,appleskin"
mcctl config modded MEMORY "6G"

# Start server
mcctl start modded

docs.title: Mixed Sources (CurseForge + Modrinth)
docs.text:
# Create Fabric server
mcctl create mixed --type FABRIC --version 1.21.1

# CurseForge mods (requires API key)
mcctl config mixed CURSEFORGE_FILES "jei,journeymap"

# Modrinth mods (no API key needed)
mcctl config mixed MODRINTH_PROJECTS "fabric-api,sodium,lithium"

# Restart to apply
mcctl stop mixed && mcctl start mixed

docs.title: Pinned Versions for Reproducibility
docs.text:
# Pin specific file versions for consistent builds
mcctl config myserver CURSEFORGE_FILES "jei:4593548,journeymap:4596105,jade:4587399"

docs.title: Auto-Removal and Upgrades
docs.text:
• Files are automatically upgraded when newer versions are available
  • Removed references are automatically cleaned up
  • To remove all CurseForge mods:
# Clear all CurseForge mods
mcctl config myserver CURSEFORGE_FILES ""
mcctl stop myserver && mcctl start myserver

docs.title: Dependencies
docs.text:
Manual Dependency Management

CurseForge can detect missing dependencies but cannot automatically resolve them.

You must manually add required dependencies to CURSEFORGE_FILES.

Example: If JEI requires Forge API, you need to add both:

mcctl config myserver CURSEFORGE_FILES "jei,forge-api"

docs.title: Advanced Configuration (Manual)
docs.text:
For complex configurations, edit config.env directly:

nano ~/minecraft-servers/servers/myserver/config.env

Example config.env:

# CurseForge mods (multi-line format)
CURSEFORGE_FILES=jei
journeymap
jade
mouse-tweaks
appleskin
storage-drawers

docs.title: Using Listing Files
docs.text:
For very large mod lists:

# Create mod list file
nano ~/minecraft-servers/servers/myserver/data/cf-mods.txt

Content of cf-mods.txt:

# Core mods
jei
journeymap

# Utility mods
jade
mouse-tweaks

# Specific versions
create:5678901

Then reference it in config.env:

CURSEFORGE_FILES=@/data/cf-mods.txt

And mount the directory:

# This is automatically done by mcctl

docs.title: Common Issues
docs.text: Issue Cause Solution 401 Unauthorized Invalid or missing API key Verify CF_API_KEY in .env 403 Forbidden API key lacks permissions Regenerate API key from console Mod not found Wrong slug or ID Verify from CurseForge URL Version mismatch Mod doesn't support server version Use specific file ID for compatible version Missing dependencies Dependencies not resolved Manually add required mods

docs.title: Check API Key Configuration
docs.text:
# View .env file (don't share the output!)
cat ~/minecraft-servers/.env | grep CF_API_KEY

docs.title: Check Current Configuration
docs.text:
# View all configuration
mcctl config myserver

# View specific setting
mcctl config myserver CURSEFORGE_FILES

docs.title: View Server Logs
docs.text:
# Check for mod loading errors
mcctl logs myserver

# Follow logs in real-time
mcctl logs myserver -f

docs.title: Debug Mode
docs.text:
Enable debug output to troubleshoot issues:

mcctl config myserver DEBUG "true"
mcctl stop myserver && mcctl start myserver
mcctl logs myserver

docs.title: Verify API Key
docs.text:
Test your API key with curl:

curl -H "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
  "https://api.curseforge.com/v1/mods/238222"

docs.title: Direct Download
docs.text: Download mods and plugins directly from URLs or use local files.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Feature Value API Key Required No Supports Any accessible URL or local file Use Cases Custom mods, private files, direct URLs

docs.title: Methods
docs.text: Method Description Use Case MODS / PLUGINS Direct URL list Simple URL-based downloads Shared Directories Local directories Local or manually downloaded files

docs.title: Using Direct URLs
docs.text:
# Create a Fabric server
mcctl create modded --type FABRIC --version 1.21.1

# Add mods from direct URLs
mcctl config modded MODS "https://example.com/custom-mod.jar,https://github.com/user/repo/releases/download/v1.0/mod.jar"

# Restart to apply
mcctl stop modded && mcctl start modded

docs.title: Using Shared Directories
docs.text:
mcctl creates shared directories for mods and plugins:

~/minecraft-servers/
  shared/
    mods/       # Place mod JARs here
    plugins/    # Place plugin JARs here

Simply place your files in these directories and they are automatically available to all servers.

docs.title: MODS Variable
docs.text:
For Forge/Fabric servers, download mods from URLs:

# Single mod
mcctl config myserver MODS "https://example.com/custom-mod.jar"

# Multiple mods (comma-separated)
mcctl config myserver MODS "https://example.com/mod1.jar,https://example.com/mod2.jar"

# Restart to apply
mcctl stop myserver && mcctl start myserver

docs.title: PLUGINS Variable
docs.text:
For Paper/Spigot servers, download plugins from URLs:

# Single plugin
mcctl config myserver PLUGINS "https://example.com/custom-plugin.jar"

# Multiple plugins
mcctl config myserver PLUGINS "https://example.com/plugin1.jar,https://example.com/plugin2.jar"

# Restart to apply
mcctl stop myserver && mcctl start myserver

docs.title: Supported Delimiters
docs.text:
URLs can be separated by:

  • Commas: url1,url2,url3
  • Spaces: url1 url2 url3
  • Newlines (in config.env multi-line format)

docs.title: Configuration Reference
docs.text: Config Key Description MODS Comma/space/newline separated mod URLs or container paths PLUGINS Comma/space/newline separated plugin URLs or container paths

docs.title: Directory Structure
docs.text:
mcctl init creates these shared directories:

~/minecraft-servers/
  shared/
    mods/       # Shared mod files (Forge, Fabric)
    plugins/    # Shared plugin files (Paper, Spigot)

docs.title: Using Shared Directories
docs.text:
1. Place JAR files in the appropriate directory
  2. Files are automatically mounted to all servers (read-only)
  3. No configuration needed
# Example: Add a custom mod
cp ~/downloads/custom-mod.jar ~/minecraft-servers/shared/mods/

# The mod is automatically available to all Forge/Fabric servers

docs.title: Benefits
docs.text:
• Shared across servers: One file serves all servers
  • No configuration needed: Just drop files in the directory
  • Read-only mount: Server cannot modify source files
  • Easy updates: Replace file, restart servers

docs.title: GitHub Releases Download
docs.text:
# Create server
mcctl create modded --type FABRIC --version 1.21.1

# Add mods from GitHub releases
mcctl config modded MODS "https://github.com/CaffeineMC/sodium-fabric/releases/download/mc1.21-0.6.0/sodium-fabric-0.6.0+mc1.21.jar"

# Restart to apply
mcctl stop modded && mcctl start modded

docs.title: Mixed Sources
docs.text:
# Create server
mcctl create modded --type FABRIC --version 1.21.1

# Direct URLs for custom mods
mcctl config modded MODS "https://example.com/custom-mod.jar"

# Modrinth for popular mods
mcctl config modded MODRINTH_PROJECTS "fabric-api,lithium,sodium"

# Restart to apply
mcctl stop modded && mcctl start modded

docs.title: Local Development Setup
docs.text:
For mod development with local builds:

  1. Build your mod
  2. Copy to shared directory
  3. Restart server
# Copy built mod to shared directory
cp ~/my-mod/build/libs/my-mod-1.0.jar ~/minecraft-servers/shared/mods/

# Restart server to load the mod
mcctl stop modded && mcctl start modded

docs.title: Server Network with Shared Plugins
docs.text:
All servers share the same plugins from shared/plugins/:

# Create multiple servers
mcctl create lobby --type PAPER --version 1.21.1
mcctl create survival --type PAPER --version 1.21.1
mcctl create creative --type PAPER --version 1.21.1

# Place shared plugins
cp luckperms.jar ~/minecraft-servers/shared/plugins/
cp vault.jar ~/minecraft-servers/shared/plugins/

# All servers now have these plugins
mcctl start --all

docs.title: Advanced Configuration (Manual)
docs.text:
For advanced configurations, edit config.env directly:

nano ~/minecraft-servers/servers/myserver/config.env

Example config.env:

# Direct mod URLs (multi-line format)
MODS=https://example.com/mod1.jar
https://example.com/mod2.jar
https://github.com/user/repo/releases/download/v1.0/mod3.jar

# Auto-cleanup settings
REMOVE_OLD_MODS=TRUE

docs.title: Using File Lists
docs.text:
For very large mod lists:

# Create mod list file
nano ~/minecraft-servers/servers/myserver/data/mods.txt

Content of mods.txt:

# Performance mods
https://example.com/lithium.jar
https://example.com/phosphor.jar

# Utility mods
https://example.com/mod-menu.jar

# Comments starting with # are ignored
# Blank lines are also ignored

# You can also use special prefixes
modrinth:fabric-api
curseforge:jei

Then set MODS_FILE in config.env:

MODS_FILE=/data/mods.txt

docs.title: Sync Path Customization
docs.text:
Customize where mods/plugins are synced:

# In config.env
COPY_MODS_SRC=/custom-mods
COPY_MODS_DEST=/data/mods
COPY_PLUGINS_SRC=/custom-plugins
COPY_PLUGINS_DEST=/data/plugins

docs.title: Remove Old Mods
docs.text:
Configure automatic cleanup before applying new content:

mcctl config myserver REMOVE_OLD_MODS "TRUE"

docs.title: Exclude Specific Files
docs.text:
mcctl config myserver REMOVE_OLD_MODS_INCLUDE "*.jar"
mcctl config myserver REMOVE_OLD_MODS_EXCLUDE "keep-this-mod.jar"

docs.title: Common Issues
docs.text: Issue Cause Solution Download failed Invalid URL or network issue Verify URL is accessible File not found Wrong path Check shared directory location Permission denied File permissions Ensure files are readable Mods not loading Wrong server type Verify TYPE matches mod loader

docs.title: Debug Mode

Enable debug output to troubleshoot:

mcctl config myserver DEBUG "true"
mcctl stop myserver && mcctl start myserver
mcctl logs myserver

Test URL accessibility:

curl -I "https://example.com/mod.jar"

docs.title: Modpacks
docs.text: Install pre-configured modpack collections from various sources.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Platform Config Key API Key Required Best For Packwiz PACKWIZ_URL No Custom/self-hosted modpacks CurseForge CF_PAGE_URL, CF_SLUG Yes Popular modpacks Modrinth MODRINTH_MODPACK No Open-source modpacks FTB FTB_MODPACK_ID No Feed the Beast modpacks ZIP Archive MODPACK, GENERIC_PACKS No Manual/custom archives

Modpacks and Server Types

When installing modpacks, the server TYPE is often set automatically based on the modpack platform. For example, CurseForge modpacks use TYPE=AUTO_CURSEFORGE and Modrinth modpacks use TYPE=MODRINTH.

docs.title: Packwiz
docs.text: Packwiz is a command-line tool for creating and managing modpacks with support for both CurseForge and Modrinth sources.

docs.title: Quick Start with mcctl
docs.text:
# Create a Fabric server with Packwiz modpack
mcctl create modded --type FABRIC --version 1.21.1

# Set Packwiz modpack URL
mcctl config modded PACKWIZ_URL "https://example.com/modpack/pack.toml"

# Restart to apply
mcctl stop modded && mcctl start modded

docs.title: Configuration Reference
docs.text: Config Key Description PACKWIZ_URL URL to the pack.toml modpack definition file

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• Processing Order: Packwiz definitions are processed before other mod definitions (MODPACK, MODS, etc.), allowing for additional customization
  • Server-Side Only: Pre-configured to download only server-compatible mods
  • Multiple Sources: Supports both CurseForge and Modrinth mod sources

docs.title: Client-Side Mods
docs.text: If client-side mods cause issues, ensure they are marked as "client" rather than "both" in the pack.toml side setting.

docs.title: Learn More
docs.text: • Packwiz Official Documentation

docs.title: CurseForge Modpacks
docs.text: Install modpacks from CurseForge with automatic upgrade support.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
API Key Required

CurseForge requires an API key. See CurseForge Guide for setup instructions.

docs.title: Quick Start with mcctl
docs.text:
# Create server (TYPE is set automatically for CurseForge modpacks)
mcctl create modded

# Set server type for CurseForge modpack
mcctl config modded TYPE "AUTO_CURSEFORGE"

# Set modpack by page URL
mcctl config modded CF_PAGE_URL "https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/modpacks/all-the-mods-8"

# Or by slug (shorter)
mcctl config modded CF_SLUG "all-the-mods-8"

# Set memory (modpacks typically need more)
mcctl config modded MEMORY "8G"

# Restart to apply
mcctl stop modded && mcctl start modded

docs.title: Modpack Specification Methods
docs.text: Method Description Example CF_PAGE_URL Full modpack page URL https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/modpacks/all-the-mods-8 CF_SLUG Short identifier from URL all-the-mods-8 CF_FILE_ID Specific file ID for version pinning 4567890 CF_FILENAME_MATCHER Substring to match filename server

docs.title: Configuration Reference
docs.text: Config Key Description CF_API_KEY CurseForge API key (required, set in .env) CF_PAGE_URL Full URL to modpack or specific file CF_SLUG Short identifier from URL path CF_FILE_ID Specific file ID for version pinning CF_FILENAME_MATCHER Substring for desired filename matching

docs.title: Mod Filtering
docs.text:
# Exclude specific mods
mcctl config modded CF_EXCLUDE_MODS "optifine,journeymap"

# Force include mods incorrectly tagged as client-only
mcctl config modded CF_FORCE_INCLUDE_MODS "some-mod"

# Parallel download count
mcctl config modded CF_PARALLEL_DOWNLOADS "6"
Config Key Description CF_EXCLUDE_MODS Comma/space-delimited project slugs or IDs to exclude CF_FORCE_INCLUDE_MODS Force inclusion of mods incorrectly tagged as client-only CF_EXCLUDE_ALL_MODS Exclude all mods (for server-only setup) CF_PARALLEL_DOWNLOADS Number of concurrent mod downloads (default: 4)

docs.title: Complete Example
docs.text:
# Create and configure CurseForge modpack server
mcctl create atm8

# Configure modpack
mcctl config atm8 TYPE "AUTO_CURSEFORGE"
mcctl config atm8 CF_PAGE_URL "https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/modpacks/all-the-mods-8"
mcctl config atm8 MEMORY "8G"
mcctl config atm8 CF_EXCLUDE_MODS "optifine,journeymap"
mcctl config atm8 CF_PARALLEL_DOWNLOADS "6"

# Start server
mcctl start atm8

docs.text: Download mods and plugins from Modrinth - an open-source mod hosting platform.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Feature Value Official Website https://modrinth.com/ API Key Required No Dependency Resolution Automatic (optional) Version Auto-detect Yes Supported Types Mods, Plugins, Datapacks

docs.title: Create Server and Add Mods
docs.text:
# Create a Fabric server
mcctl create modded --type FABRIC --version 1.21.1

# Add Modrinth mods
mcctl config modded MODRINTH_PROJECTS "fabric-api,lithium,sodium"

# Restart to apply changes

docs.title: Finding Project Slug
docs.text:
The slug is the URL portion after /mod/ or /plugin/.

Example: https://modrinth.com/mod/fabric-api -> slug is fabric-api

Project Slug

You can use either the project slug or the project ID from Modrinth.

docs.title: Project Entry Formats
docs.text:
Use different formats in the MODRINTH_PROJECTS value:

Format Description Example project Latest release fabric-api project:version Specific version ID or number fabric-api:0.92.0 project:release Latest release type fabric-api:release project:beta Latest beta lithium:beta project:alpha Latest alpha sodium:alpha prefix:project Loader override fabric:sodium

docs.title: Version Specifiers
docs.text:
# Latest release
mcctl config myserver MODRINTH_PROJECTS "fabric-api"

# Specific version
mcctl config myserver MODRINTH_PROJECTS "fabric-api:0.92.0"

# Beta version
mcctl config myserver MODRINTH_PROJECTS "lithium:beta"

# Multiple mods with mixed versions
mcctl config myserver MODRINTH_PROJECTS "fabric-api,sodium:release,iris:beta"

docs.title: Loader Prefix
docs.text:
Override the auto-detected loader for specific projects:

# Force Fabric loader
mcctl config myserver MODRINTH_PROJECTS "fabric:fabric-api"

# Force Paper loader for plugins
mcctl config myserver MODRINTH_PROJECTS "paper:luckperms"

# Datapack
mcctl config myserver MODRINTH_PROJECTS "datapack:better-villages"

docs.title: Core Settings
docs.text:
# Add mods (comma-separated)
mcctl config myserver MODRINTH_PROJECTS "fabric-api,lithium,sodium"

# Download dependencies automatically
mcctl config myserver MODRINTH_DOWNLOAD_DEPENDENCIES "required"

# Default version type for all mods
mcctl config myserver MODRINTH_PROJECTS_DEFAULT_VERSION_TYPE "release"

docs.title: Dependency Options
docs.text: Value Description none No dependencies (default) required Download required dependencies only optional Download required and optional dependencies

docs.title: Version Control

mcctl config myserver VERSION_FROM_MODRINTH_PROJECTS "true"

# Override loader type
mcctl config myserver MODRINTH_LOADER "fabric"

docs.text: Config Key Default Description MODRINTH_PROJECTS - Comma or newline separated list of projects MODRINTH_DOWNLOAD_DEPENDENCIES none none, required, or optional MODRINTH_PROJECTS_DEFAULT_VERSION_TYPE release Default: release, beta, alpha VERSION_FROM_MODRINTH_PROJECTS false Auto-set Minecraft version MODRINTH_LOADER auto Override loader type

mcctl create performance --type FABRIC --version 1.21.1

# Configure mods

mcctl create survival --type PAPER --version 1.21.1

mcctl config survival MODRINTH_PROJECTS "luckperms,vault,chunky,spark"
mcctl config survival MEMORY "4G"

docs.text:
# Set default to beta
mcctl config myserver MODRINTH_PROJECTS_DEFAULT_VERSION_TYPE "beta"

mcctl config myserver MODRINTH_PROJECTS "fabric-api,sodium:release,iris:alpha"

docs.title: Advanced Configuration (Manual)
docs.text:
For advanced multi-line configurations, edit config.env directly:

nano ~/minecraft-servers/servers/myserver/config.env

Example config.env:

# Modrinth mods (multi-line format)
MODRINTH_PROJECTS=fabric-api
lithium
phosphor
ferritecore
krypton
c2me-fabric

# Dependency settings
MODRINTH_DOWNLOAD_DEPENDENCIES=required

docs.text:
For very large mod lists, use a listing file:

nano ~/minecraft-servers/servers/myserver/data/mods.txt

Content of mods.txt:

# Performance mods
fabric-api
lithium
sodium

# Utility mods
iris:beta
modmenu

# Specific versions
fabric-api:0.92.0

Then reference it in config.env:

MODRINTH_PROJECTS=@/data/mods.txt

When you remove a project from MODRINTH_PROJECTS, the corresponding file is automatically removed from the server.

# Restart to apply (sodium will be removed)
mcctl stop myserver && mcctl start myserver

Spiget vs Spigot

The config key uses SPIGET (with an "E"), not "SPIGOT". Spiget is a third-party API that provides programmatic access to SpigotMC resources.

docs.text: The resource ID is the numeric portion at the end of the SpigotMC resource URL.

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: Plugin URL Resource ID LuckPerms https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/luckperms.28140/ 28140 Vault https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/vault.34315/ 34315 PlaceholderAPI https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/placeholderapi.6245/ 6245 WorldEdit https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/worldedit.13932/ 13932 CoreProtect https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/coreprotect.8631/ 8631

docs.title: How to Find Resource ID
docs.text:
1. Go to SpigotMC Resources
  2. Search for the plugin you want
  3. Click on the plugin to open its page
  4. Look at the URL: https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/plugin-name.XXXXX/
  5. The number at the end (XXXXX) is the resource ID

docs.title: Basic Setup
docs.text:
# Add plugins (comma-separated numeric IDs)
mcctl config myserver SPIGET_RESOURCES "28140,34315,6245"

docs.text: Config Key Description SPIGET_RESOURCES Comma-separated list of SpigotMC resource IDs

docs.title: File Handling
docs.text:
The Spiget API handles different file types automatically:

File Type Action .jar file Moved directly to plugins directory .zip file Extracted into plugins directory

docs.title: Limitations
docs.text:
Download Restrictions

Some plugins on SpigotMC restrict automated downloads through Spiget. These plugins require external download authentication that Spiget cannot provide.

Example restricted plugins:

  • EssentialsX (ID: 9089)
  • Some premium plugins

For these plugins, manually download and use the shared plugins directory.

docs.title: Manual Download Alternative
docs.text:
For restricted plugins, use the shared plugins directory:

# Download plugin manually and place in shared directory
# Location: ~/minecraft-servers/shared/plugins/

# The file will be automatically available to all servers

mcctl create survival --type PAPER --version 1.21.1

mcctl config survival SPIGET_RESOURCES "28140,34315,6245"

mcctl start survival

  3. The plugin will be available to all servers
# Create server (manual plugins are auto-mounted)
mcctl create survival --type PAPER --version 1.21.1

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text: This guide covers common issues and their solutions when using mcctl and the Minecraft Docker Server platform.

docs.title: Quick Diagnostics
docs.text:
Before diving into specific issues, run these commands to gather information:

# Check overall status
mcctl status --detail

# Check mc-router health
mcctl status router

# Check specific server logs
mcctl logs <server-name> -n 100

# Test RCON connection
mcctl console <server-name>

docs.title: World Not Saving to /worlds/ Directory
docs.text:
Affects versions 1.6.8 ~ 1.6.11

This is a critical bug affecting npm package users who created servers with mcctl versions 1.6.8 through 1.6.11.

Symptoms:

  • World data is stored in servers/<name>/data/<world>/ instead of worlds/<world>/
  • Server logs show "No existing world data, creating new world" on every restart
  • World sharing between servers doesn't work
  • Players lose their progress after server restart

Cause:

The npm package template was missing EXTRA_ARGS=--universe /worlds/ configuration, causing servers to store worlds in the wrong location.

How to Check if Affected:

# If this command shows any output, you're affected
ls ~/minecraft-servers/servers/*/data/*/level.dat 2>/dev/null

Solution:

Option 1: Migration Command (Recommended)Option 2: Manual Fix 
# Check which servers need migration
mcctl migrate status

# Migrate all affected servers
mcctl migrate worlds --all

# Or migrate a specific server
mcctl migrate worlds <server-name>

# Preview changes without applying
mcctl migrate worlds --all --dry-run

Step 1: Add EXTRA_ARGS to server's config.env:

echo 'EXTRA_ARGS=--universe /worlds/' >> ~/minecraft-servers/servers/<server-name>/config.env

Or add to global .env (applies to all servers):

echo 'EXTRA_ARGS=--universe /worlds/' >> ~/minecraft-servers/.env

Step 2: Move existing world data:

# Stop server first
mcctl stop <server-name>

# Move world from data/ to worlds/
mv ~/minecraft-servers/servers/<server-name>/data/<level-name> ~/minecraft-servers/worlds/<level-name>

# Start server
mcctl start <server-name>

Step 3: Verify world is loading correctly:

mcctl logs <server-name> -f
# Should NOT see "No existing world data, creating new world"

Prevention:

Update to mcctl version 1.6.12 or later:

npm update -g @minecraft-docker/mcctl

docs.title: Server Won't Start
docs.text:
Symptoms: Server container exits immediately or fails to start.

Diagnosis:

mcctl logs <server-name> -n 100

Common Causes:

Cause Log Message Solution Wrong Java version UnsupportedClassVersionError Change image tag (java8, java17, java21) Out of memory OutOfMemoryError Increase MEMORY in config.env EULA not accepted EULA must be accepted Set EULA=TRUE in .env Port conflict Address already in use Check other services using the port Corrupt world java.io.IOException Restore from backup

Java Version Guide:

Minecraft Version Required Java 1.21+ Java 21 1.18 - 1.20.4 Java 17 or 21 Forge 1.16.5 and below Java 8

docs.title: Cannot Connect to Server
docs.text:
Symptoms: Minecraft client shows "Can't connect to server" or "Connection refused".

Diagnosis:

# Check if mc-router is running
mcctl status router

# Check if server is running
mcctl status <server-name>

# Test RCON connection
mcctl console <server-name>

Common Causes:

Cause Solution mc-router not running mcctl router start Server not running mcctl start <server-name> Wrong hostname Use correct format: <server>.<ip>.nip.io:25565 Firewall blocking Open port 25565 DNS not resolving Use IP address directly or check nip.io

docs.title: Slow Performance
docs.text:
Symptoms: Server lag, high TPS, slow chunk loading.

Diagnosis:

mcctl status <server-name> --detail

Solutions:

# Enable Aikar's JVM flags
mcctl config <server-name> USE_AIKAR_FLAGS true

# Reduce view distance
mcctl config <server-name> VIEW_DISTANCE 8

# Reduce simulation distance
mcctl config <server-name> SIMULATION_DISTANCE 6

# Restart server
mcctl stop <server-name> && mcctl start <server-name>

docs.title: World Corruption
docs.text:
Symptoms: Missing chunks, corrupted blocks, server crashes on load.

Diagnosis:

# Check world lock status
mcctl world list

# Check server logs for errors
mcctl logs <server-name> | grep -i error

Solutions:

  1. Restore from backup: 

    mcctl backup restore

  2. Check world locking: 

    # Ensure world is not assigned to multiple servers
mcctl world list

# Release and reassign if needed
mcctl world release <world-name>
mcctl world assign <world-name> <server-name>

docs.title: Mods/Plugins Not Loading
docs.text:
Symptoms: Server starts but mods or plugins don't appear.

Diagnosis:

mcctl logs <server-name> | grep -i "mod\|plugin"

Common Causes:

Cause Solution Wrong server type Use FORGE/FABRIC for mods, PAPER for plugins Version mismatch Match mod version with Minecraft version Missing dependencies Install required dependency mods File permissions Check file ownership in shared/ directory

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text:
If your issue isn't covered here:

  1. Check server logs: mcctl logs <server-name> -n 200
  2. Check Docker logs: docker logs mc-<server-name>
  3. Ask the AI Assistant: AI Assistant
  4. Open a GitHub Issue: GitHub Issues

When reporting issues, please include:

  • mcctl version (mcctl --version)
  • Docker version (docker --version)
  • Operating system
  • Relevant log output
  • Steps to reproduce

cd platform/services/cli

# 빌드
pnpm build

# 직접 실행
npx tsx src/index.ts --help

# 글로벌 링크
pnpm link --global
mcctl --help

docs.title: CLI Mode (인자 전달)
docs.text:
# 기본 생성 (PAPER 서버)
mcctl create myserver

# 서버 타입 지정
mcctl create myserver -t PAPER
mcctl create myserver -t VANILLA
mcctl create myserver -t FORGE
mcctl create myserver -t FABRIC

# 버전 지정
mcctl create myserver -t PAPER -v 1.21.1
mcctl create myserver -t FORGE -v 1.20.4

# 월드 시드 지정
mcctl create myserver -t PAPER -v 1.21.1 -s 12345678

# 월드 다운로드 URL
mcctl create myserver -t PAPER --world-url https://example.com/world.zip

# 기존 월드 사용 (worlds/ 디렉토리에 있는 월드)
mcctl create myserver -t PAPER -w survival

# 생성만 하고 시작하지 않음
mcctl create myserver -t PAPER --no-start

# 모든 옵션 조합
mcctl create myserver -t FORGE -v 1.20.4 -s 12345 --no-start

출력 예시:

docs.title: 백업 관리
docs.text:
백업 기능을 사용하려면 .env 파일에 GitHub 설정이 필요합니다:

BACKUP_GITHUB_TOKEN=ghp_xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
BACKUP_GITHUB_REPO=username/minecraft-worlds-backup
BACKUP_GITHUB_BRANCH=main
BACKUP_AUTO_ON_STOP=true

docs.title: 글로벌 옵션
docs.text:
모든 명령어에서 사용할 수 있는 옵션:

# 커스텀 데이터 디렉토리
mcctl --root /path/to/data <command>

# JSON 출력 (지원되는 명령어)
mcctl status --json
mcctl world list --json
mcctl backup history --json

# 도움말
mcctl --help
mcctl create --help
mcctl world --help

# 버전 확인

docs.title: 1. 첫 서버 설정
docs.text:
# 플랫폼 초기화
mcctl init

# 첫 서버 생성 (대화형)
mcctl create

# 또는 CLI로 직접
mcctl create myserver -t PAPER -v 1.21.1

# Minecraft에서 접속
# 서버 주소: myserver.local:25565

docs.title: 2. 모드 서버 추가
docs.text:
# Forge 모드 서버 생성
mcctl create modded -t FORGE -v 1.20.4

# 상태 확인
mcctl status

# Minecraft에서 접속
# 서버 주소: modded.local:25565

docs.title: 3. 월드 마이그레이션
docs.text:
# 월드 목록 확인
mcctl world list

# 기존 서버에서 월드 잠금 해제
mcctl world release survival

# 새 서버에 월드 할당
mcctl world assign survival mc-newserver

docs.title: 4. 백업 및 복원
docs.text:
# 업그레이드 전 백업
mcctl backup push -m "Before 1.21.2 upgrade"

# 서버 업그레이드 (config.env 수정 후)
docker compose up -d mc-myserver

# 문제 발생 시 복원
mcctl backup history
mcctl backup restore abc1234

docs.title: 5. 서버 정리
docs.text:
# 사용하지 않는 서버 삭제
mcctl delete oldserver

# 월드 데이터는 보존됨
mcctl world list

docs.title: 플랫폼이 초기화되지 않음
docs.text:
Error: Platform not initialized. Run: mcctl init

해결: mcctl init 실행

docs.title: Docker가 설치되지 않음
docs.text:
Error: Docker is not installed or not running

해결: Docker 설치 및 실행 확인 - https://docs.docker.com/get-docker/

docs.title: mDNS가 작동하지 않음
docs.text:
Warning: avahi-daemon not found - mDNS will not work

해결: 

# Ubuntu/Debian
sudo apt install avahi-daemon
sudo systemctl enable --now avahi-daemon

# 수동 hosts 설정 (대안)
echo "192.168.1.100 myserver.local" | sudo tee -a /etc/hosts

docs.title: 월드가 이미 잠김
docs.text:
Error: World 'survival' is already locked by 'mc-otherserver'

해결: 

# 잠금 해제 후 재할당
mcctl world release survival --force
mcctl world assign survival mc-myserver

docs.title: Minecraft Docker Server Manager
docs.text:
Docker와 mcctl CLI를 사용하여 여러 Minecraft Java Edition 서버를 관리하는 DevOps 솔루션입니다.

중요: 버전 1.6.8 ~ 1.6.11의 월드 저장 버그

mcctl 버전 1.6.8부터 1.6.11로 서버를 생성한 경우, 월드 데이터가 잘못된 위치에 저장되어 서버 재시작 시 월드가 새로 생성될 수 있습니다.

빠른 확인: ls ~/minecraft-servers/servers/*/data/*/level.dat 2>/dev/null 실행 - 출력이 있으면 영향받은 것입니다.

해결: 1.6.12 이상으로 업데이트 후 mcctl migrate worlds --all 실행

자세한 내용은 문제 해결 가이드를 참조하세요.

docs.title: 주요 기능
docs.text:
• 멀티 서버 관리: 단일 호스트에서 여러 Minecraft 서버 실행
  • 호스트네임 기반 라우팅: mc-router를 통해 server.local:25565로 접속
  • nip.io 매직 DNS: server.<ip>.nip.io로 클라이언트 설정 없이 접속
  • 오토 스케일링: 접속 시 서버 시작, 유휴 시간 후 자동 종료
  • 대화형 CLI: @clack/prompts 기반의 아름다운 터미널 UI
  • 월드 관리: 서버 간 월드 할당, 잠금, 해제
  • 플레이어 관리: CLI를 통한 운영자, 화이트리스트, 밴, 킥
  • GitHub 백업: 비공개 저장소에 자동 월드 백업

docs.title: 시스템 요구사항
docs.text: 구성요소 최소 버전 비고 Node.js >= 18.0.0 20 LTS 권장 Docker Engine >= 24.0.0 Docker Compose >= 2.20.0 include 기능 필요

docs.title: 빠른 시작
docs.text:
# CLI 전역 설치
npm install -g @minecraft-docker/mcctl

# 플랫폼 초기화
mcctl init

# 서버 생성 (대화형 모드)
mcctl create

# 또는 인자와 함께
mcctl create myserver -t PAPER -v 1.21.1

# 서버 시작/중지
mcctl start myserver
mcctl stop myserver

# 상태 보기
mcctl status

docs.title: 주요 명령어
docs.text: 명령어 설명 mcctl create 새 서버 생성 (대화형) mcctl start <name> 서버 시작 mcctl stop <name> 서버 중지 mcctl status 모든 서버 상태 표시 mcctl logs <name> 서버 로그 보기 mcctl console <name> RCON 콘솔 연결 mcctl config <name> 서버 설정 보기/편집

docs.text: 사용법이나 설정에 대해 궁금한 점이 있으신가요? AI 어시스턴트에게 물어보세요 - 이 문서를 학습한 AI가 질문에 대화형으로 답변해 드립니다.

docs.text:

  • itzg/minecraft-server 문서

docs.title: Admin Service 개요
docs.text: Admin Service는 Docker Minecraft 서버를 위한 웹 기반 관리 인터페이스와 REST API를 제공합니다. 현대적인 웹 콘솔을 통해 원격 서버 관리, 모니터링, 운영이 가능합니다.

docs.title: mcctl-api (REST API 서버)
docs.text:
Fastify 기반의 REST API 서버로 다음 기능을 제공합니다:

  • 서버 관리: Minecraft 서버 목록 조회, 시작, 중지, 재시작
  • 서버 정보: 상태, 플레이어, 리소스 사용량 확인
  • RCON 통합: 원격으로 콘솔 명령 실행
  • Swagger 문서: /docs에서 자동 생성된 API 문서 확인
  • 상태 확인: /health에서 내장 헬스 체크

기본 포트: 3001

docs.title: mcctl-console (웹 관리 UI)
docs.text:
Next.js 웹 애플리케이션으로 다음 기능을 제공합니다:

  • 대시보드: 모든 서버의 실시간 상태 개요
  • 서버 상세: 상세한 서버 정보와 제어 기능
  • 사용자 인증: NextAuth.js를 통한 보안 로그인
  • BFF 프록시: 안전한 API 접근을 위한 Backend-for-Frontend 패턴

기본 포트: 3000

docs.title: 인증 모드
docs.text:
Admin Service는 다양한 인증 모드를 지원합니다:

모드 설명 사용 사례 internal Docker 네트워크 내부만 허용 (가장 안전) 기본 프로덕션 api-key X-API-Key 헤더로 외부 접근 자동화/스크립트 ip-whitelist IP 기반 접근 제어 알려진 클라이언트 IP api-key-ip API 키와 IP 모두 필요 고보안 환경 open 인증 없음 개발 환경 전용

보안 경고

프로덕션 환경에서는 절대 open 모드를 사용하지 마세요. 모든 인증이 비활성화되어 서버가 무단 접근에 노출됩니다.
